abstract: Bipartisan group of senators is working on bundle of regulatory reform bills that is likely to include measure that will place stricter scrutiny on independent regulators like Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and Securities and Exchange Commission; critics say measure will make agency rules more vulnerable to legal challenges and will lead to delays when issuing rules for Wall Street, while supporters say legislation will increase transparency.

headline.print_headline: Proposed Legislation Would Add Scrutiny of Wall Street Regulators
headline.main: Proposed Legislation Would Add Scrutiny of Wall Street Regulators

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

snippet: Critics warn that the legislation is intended to create additional burdens and delays in the regulation process.
lead_paragraph: Critics warn that the legislation is intended to create additional burdens and delays in the regulation process.
